intro: Leucas masaiensis var. masaiensis, commonly known as the Masai leucas, is a perennial herb native to East Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, tubular flowers in shades of purple or blue, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This species is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
